title: Henry and Mudge in the Sparkle Days
author: Cynthia Rylant

book_level.description: Early reader level - simple story about a boy, his dog, and winter family moments

questions.question: What is the name of Henry's dog?

options.B: Mudge

questions.explanation: Henry's big dog is named Mudge.

questions.question: What season do Henry and Mudge love?

options.B: Fall

questions.explanation: Henry and Mudge love winter because they love snow.

questions.question: What were Henry and Mudge waiting for at the beginning?

options.B: The first snow

questions.explanation: Henry and Mudge were waiting for the first snow of winter.

questions.question: What does Henry say every morning and night while waiting?

options.B: Not yet, Mudge

questions.explanation: Henry looks out his window and says 'Not yet, Mudge' each time.

questions.question: What always makes Mudge sneeze?

options.B: Flowers

questions.explanation: When Mudge poked his nose in the snow, he sneezed. 'Snow always made him sneeze.'

questions.question: What did Mudge do when Henry made snow angels?

options.B: Messed them up

questions.explanation: When Henry made snow angels, Mudge laid down and messed them up.

questions.question: Who bakes the cookies in Henry's family?

options.B: Henry's mother

questions.explanation: Henry's mother liked to bake the cookies, and Henry helped decorate them.

questions.question: When Henry got dressed for snow, Mudge barked at him because ---.

options.B: he didn't recognize Henry in all his snow clothes

questions.explanation: Mudge barked at the strange creature until Henry took off his mask and showed his face.

questions.question: At first, Mudge was not invited to Christmas Eve dinner because ---.

options.B: it was a fancy dinner and he was a dog

questions.explanation: Mudge hadn't been invited to the fancy Christmas Eve dinner because he was a dog.

questions.question: Henry thought 'dressing the turkey' was funny because ---.

options.B: he imagined putting clothes on a turkey

questions.explanation: Henry giggled at the idea of 'dressing' a turkey because it sounds like putting clothes on it.

questions.question: When the family heard Mudge crying, they decided to ---.

options.B: let him join the fancy dinner

questions.explanation: They all felt sorry for Mudge, so Henry's father got an extra plate and they let Mudge join them.

questions.question: On winter night walks, the family loved seeing ---.

options.B: warm lights in houses, stars, and the sparkle of the moon

questions.explanation: They loved the warm lights in houses, winter stars, and the sparkle of the moon on white yards.

questions.question: When they saw a shooting star, Henry wished for ---.

options.B: more snow
options.C: chocolate pudding every day for the rest of his life

questions.explanation: Henry wished for chocolate pudding every day for the rest of his life.

questions.question: What did the family do after their winter walk?

options.B: they watched TV

questions.explanation: After their walk, they loved coming home to their fireplace and resting together.

questions.question: What does the title 'Sparkle Days' refer to?

options.B: Days when snow makes everything sparkle and shine
options.C: Days when they clean the house
options.D: Days when the sun is bright

questions.explanation: Sparkle days are snowy winter days when the snow sparkles, and the house sparkles with Christmas decorations.

questions.question: What theme is shown when the family lets Mudge join Christmas dinner?

options.B: Family includes everyone, even pets

questions.explanation: Including Mudge shows that family means everyone, including beloved pets.

questions.question: Why might Mudge have sneezed 'fancy turkey' on Henry at dinner?

options.B: He ate too fast because he was excited

questions.explanation: Mudge ate as fast as he could because it was his first fancy dinner, and the excitement made him sneeze.

questions.question: What does the firelight scene at the end of the book represent?

options.B: The warmth and comfort of family togetherness

questions.explanation: The quiet moment by the fire represents family closeness and the peaceful joy of being together.

questions.question: Why does Henry think Mudge's wish would be for 'half of his chocolate pudding'?

options.B: Henry knows Mudge loves sharing food with him

questions.explanation: Henry's joke shows how close they are - Mudge would want to share whatever Henry has.

questions.question: What is the main message of Henry and Mudge in the Sparkle Days?

options.B: Snow is fun to play in
options.C: The joy of winter comes from sharing special moments with family and loved ones

questions.explanation: The book shows that what makes winter magical is sharing snow play, Christmas, and firelight with family - including Mudge.
